page.title: 18LOCAL NEWS
page.content: {HINCKLEY CARNIVAL On the 15th of June 1985 Hinckley held its{Annual Carnival.}Forty decorated trucks and bands paraded through the streets of Hinckley. This annual event raised a record Â£1420 for charity and was watched by thousands of people. The theme of floats was to celebrate the carnival's silver jubilee and many floats depicted how life had changed in the last twenty-five years. One showed twenty-five years of space travel while another showed the children's T.V.programmes over the last quarter of a centuary. The procession ended at Claredon Fields where there was many stalls with games, competitions and things to buy. There was a great atmosphere.
